abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column relates former New Jersey Atty Gen John J Farmer Jr's recollections concerning rumors that local Muslims celebrated terrorist attack on World Trade Center in 2001; notes Farmer's account firmly refutes Donald J Trump's claim of having seen thousands of Muslims cheer attacks in Jersey City.
lead_paragraph: Few are more qualified than John J. Farmer Jr. to assess the idea being peddled by Mr. Trump that Muslims danced in the streets of New Jersey when the World Trade Center fell.

headline.main: A Definitive Debunking of Donald Trump’s 9/11 Claims
headline.print_headline: Trump Refuted With Authority on 9/11 Claim

snippet: Few are more qualified than John J. Farmer Jr. to assess the idea being peddled by Mr. Trump that Muslims danced in the streets of New Jersey when the World Trade Center fell.

keywords.value: National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States
